description: From Middle English þennes, from þenne +‎ -es (“adverbial ending”), the former from þanan, þanona, from Proto-West Germanic *þananā. Cognate with Westphalian Low German diëne.

entries.meaning: (formal) From there, from that place or from that time.
examples: Cross fix at 6000 feet, thence descend to 3000 feet and fly direct to MAP (missed approach point).

entries.meaning: (literary) Deriving from this fact or circumstance; therefore, therefrom.
